div.p: Use this document to install the required software on your computer to develop, review, and publish your very first technical documentation project.

section.p: To document and publish your first technical documentation project, you will need the following:

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

h1.span: Setting up the XML Authoring Environment

h2.span: Installing the Oxygen XML Authoring Tool

section.p: Use this procedure to install the Oxygen XML authoring tool (version 25.0 or later).
You can also watch the following video for more information on the installation.

li.span: On a browser instance, type www.oxygenxml.com.
Click Products > Oxygen XML Author.

img.alt: Displays a web page with a snapshot of products that include the Oxygen XML Author.
img.css:oxy-alt-text: Displays a web page with a snapshot of products that include the Oxygen XML Author.

li.span: Click Downloads > Download.
li.div: The following page displays: Figure 2. Installation -- Download Oxygen XML Author for 64-bit Windows

li.span: Select the tab that corresponds to your operating system (here, Windows), and click Download.
li.div: The executable (.exe) file downloads to your system.

li.span: In the page that displays, enter the required details, to obtain your 30-day trial license.

span.span: Oxygen Installation -- Getting the trial license

img.alt: Displays the form to enter the required details to obtain the 30-day trial license.
img.css:oxy-alt-text: Displays the form to enter the required details to obtain the 30-day trial license.

li.span: Start the installation wizard to install the Oxygen XML author.
Double-click the Oxygen XML Author shortcut on your desktop to invoke an instance of the software.
When prompted, enter the 9-line license text in the space provided.
li.div: To learn more about the Oxygen XML Author, visit: https://www.oxygenxml.com/doc/versions/25.0/ug-author.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Before you start work on GitHub, you must first create your personal account.
div.section: Use this procedure to create your own personal and free account to serve as your identity on GitHub.

li.span: On a browser instance, navigate to: www.github.com.
On the top right hand corner, click Sign up.
In the popup dialog that displays, enter your email ID and a strong password.
Click Continue to create a free personal account to sign in to GitHub.

div.p: Sign in to GitHub to access projects and repositories.
div.section: Before you begin, you must create a GitHub account.

section.p: After you create an account in GitHub, you can sign in to access your project space or repositories anytime.

li.span: On a browser instance, navigate to: www.github.com.
On the top right hand corner, click Sign in.
Enter your credentials in the pop up dialog that displays, and click Sign in.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

h1.span: Publishing the outputs from DITA XML

div.section: Sign in to your personal GitHub account. For more information, see: Signing in to GitHub (on page ).

section.p: Use this procedure to create a public GitHub repository.

li.span: On an instance of a web browser, enter www.github.com.
Sign in to GitHub with your credentials.
On the top right corner of the page, click the drop-down arrow next to the plus (+) sign, and select New repository.
li.div: The Create a new repository page displays:

li.span: Create a GitHub repository for your project files.
In the Repository name* field, enter a name for your repository of project files.
Enter a description for the repository.
Select Public.

div.div: Important: Ensure that you create a public repository. That way anyone who has the URL to the repository will be able to access it.

li.span: Click Create repository.

section.p: Use this procedure to publish outputs using the default transforms that come with the Oxygen XML authoring tool.

li.span: Open the ditamap in the DITA Maps Manager.
Click Configure Transformation Scenario(s).
Select the following transforms:

ul.li: DITA Map PDF - based on HTML5 & CSS (to publish to PDF)
DITA Map HTML5 (to publish to HTML5)

li.span: Click Apply associated.

h2.span: Uploading DITA XML source files to GitHub repository

div.section: Before you begin, ensure that you create a public GitHub repository.

section.p: You must upload DITA XML source files from the locally stored folder on your computer to the GitHub repository, so that the files and the published outputs can be viewed publicly.

li.span: Go to http://www.github.com.
Click the link to your public repository (for example, DITA-XML sample) under Top repositories on the left hand side of the web page.
li.div: The repository opens up in the web page as follows:

li.span: Click uploading an existing file.
Drag and drop the entire folder from your local folder to the repository, in the space provided.

div.div: Attention: Ensure that you upload the entire folder with all the supporting files like images etc., to the repository.

li.span: Click Commit Changes.
